intro: Euphrasia sagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf toothwort, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it is often found in rich, loamy soils. Euphrasia sagittata is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants.
